intro: Illecebrum nanum, commonly known as the dwarf spiderwort, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, which bloom in spring and summer. Illecebrum nanum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its compact size and vibrant floral display.
